meanings.definition: A person who imitates or follows the work or style of another, especially an inferior imitator.
meanings.sent1: The young artist was considered an epigones of the famous painter, copying his every brushstroke.
meanings.sent2: The epigones of the fashion designer tried to replicate his unique designs but fell short.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about epigones trying to mimic a famous comedian.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, many aspiring singers are mere epigones of the legendary performers.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was filled with epigones of the teacher, echoing her every word and gesture.
